column4: hey everyone, i'm having a problem with rsync on my ubuntu installation
what problem?
I use rsync to sync directories of files between my main computer and this file server that has ubuntu.  Randomly and for no reason now, rsync seems to freeze
what size are the directories?
I haven't changed *anything* on the ubuntu computer, and nothing should have happened to my os x machine in regards to rsync either.  I need to back up my files but now i can't.  any advice?
tar/gz the backup and scp it over instead of rsync
one directory is around 50gigs, the other is under 10 gigs.  The problem is the size of either hasn't changed too drastically
ext2/3? over 40,000 directories?
it has worked before. and i'm not sure if it's over 40k directories, but it has gone from working, to not working
run -v and see if it stops on the same file time after time again
ikonia i agree, i'd just let the command run for 15-30 minutes and see if there's any progress
how many files are in that directory
17296.  It's started to transfer the first file, but it's already stopped moving on it
it's a 50 meg file, transfering on a direct connection between the two computers
are you trying to sync only that one file? is the destination drive full?
i'd also run a tcpdump or wireshark to see if any packets are being sent over the line

in a second terminal run the command:   sudo tcpdump -i eth0 host 192.168.10.10                   and change the host ip to your destination box, it won't say much because the packets are encrypted, but you'll be able to see if there's any traffic between the two
i get the error: tcpdump: BIOCSETIF: eth0: Device not configured
replace eth0 with whatever interface you're using to do backups on
that is the device though, eth0 is what is connected to the other computer
and i know somehow eth0 works because i can still ssh to the machine
so it's been ten minutes on a transfer that took me two minutes a week ago on a similarly sized directory
you may wish to check out the rsync channel here on freenode
unfortunately the #rsync channel here doesn't seem to have anyone alive in it..
